Description: Rim sherd (mended from three fragments and added plaster) of North Ionian cup, or bowl; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; one band in added red lined in white; exterior: black band at top of rim; below, large maeander and square band; line and glazed area below.
Curator's comments: Probably from same bowl as 1924,1201.875 and 876; if so the preserved diameter of this piece indicates that there would have been a lotus flower on one side only.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.993)
